1.text: And they brought in the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings before God.

2.text: And when David had made an end of offering the burnt-offering and the peace-offerings, he blessed the people in the name of Jehovah.

3.text: And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a portion of flesh, and a cake of raisins.

4.text: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of Jehovah, and to celebrate and to thank and praise Jehovah, the God of Israel:

5.text: Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, with psalteries and with harps; and Asaph with cymbals, sounding aloud;

6.text: and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually, before the ark of the covenant of God.

7.text: Then on that day did David first ordain to give thanks unto Jehovah, by the hand of Asaph and his brethren.

8.text: O give thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name; Make known his doings among the peoples.

9.text: Sing unto him, sing praises unto him; Talk ye of all his marvellous works.

10.text: Glory ye in his holy name; Let the heart of them rejoice that seek Jehovah.

11.text: Seek ye Jehovah and his strength; Seek his face evermore.

12.text: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done, His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

13.text: O ye seed of Israel his servant, Ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.

14.text: He is Jehovah our God; His judgments are in all the earth.

15.text: Remember his covenant for ever, The word which he commanded to a thousand generations,

16.text: The covenant which he made with Abraham, And his oath unto Isaac,

17.text: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a statute, To Israel for an everlasting covenant,

18.text: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, The lot of your inheritance;

19.text: When ye were but a few men in number, Yea, very few, and sojourners in it;

20.text: And they went about from nation to nation, And from one kingdom to another people.

21.text: He suffered no man to do them wrong; Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,

22.text: Saying, Touch not mine anointed ones, And do my prophets no harm.

23.text: Sing unto Jehovah, all the earth; Show forth his salvation from day to day.

24.text: Declare his glory among the nations, His marvellous works among all the peoples.

25.text: For great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised: He also is to be feared above all gods.

26.text: For all the gods of the peoples are idols: But Jehovah made the heavens.

27.text: Honor and majesty are before him: Strength and gladness are in his place.

28.text: Ascribe unto Jehovah, ye kindreds of the peoples, Ascribe unto Jehovah glory and strength;

29.text: Ascribe unto Jehovah the glory due unto his name: Bring an offering, and come before him; Worship Jehovah in holy array.

30.text: Tremble before him, all the earth: The world also is established that it cannot be moved.

31.text: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; And let them say among the nations, Jehovah reigneth.

32.text: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; Let the field exult, and all that is therein;

33.text: Then shall the trees of the wood sing for joy before Jehovah; For he cometh to judge the earth.

34.text: O give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.

35.text: And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation, And gather us together and deliver us from the nations, To give thanks unto thy holy name, And to triumph in thy praise.

36.text: Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, From everlasting even to everlasting. And all the people said, Amen, and praised Jehovah.

37.text: So he left there, before the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every dayâ€™s work required;

38.text: and Obed-edom with their brethren, threescore and eight; Obed-edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be doorkeepers;

39.text: and Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of Jehovah in the high place that was at Gibeon,

40.text: to offer burnt-offerings unto Jehovah upon the altar of burnt-offering continually morning and evening, even according to all that is written in the law of Jehovah, which he commanded unto Israel;

41.text: and with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were mentioned by name, to give thanks to Jehovah, because his lovingkindness endureth for ever;

42.text: and with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should sound aloud, and with instruments for the songs of God; and the sons of Jeduthun to be at the gate.

43.text: And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.
